headline: Weyerhaeuser Stock Trades for Less Than the Value of Its Lumber. It’s Time to Buy.
summary: When it comes to lumber producer  Weyerhaeuser  investors can’t see the forest for the trees—quite literally.  The 125-year-old company is the largest private owner of timberland in North America, with over 10 million acres, including valuable tracts in the Pacific Northwest, where it holds over two million acres.  It also operates 33 manufacturing plants across the continent, where it produces wood products.
